title: 007 hunk Daniel Craig doesn't like it when people approach him for selfies
text:
007 hunk Daniel Craig doesn't like it when people approach him for selfies 007 hunk Daniel Craig doesn't like it when people approach him for selfies Share 
James Bond actor Daniel Craig has said he cannot understand why he is bombarded by selfie-hunters. 
The 47-year-old, due to reprise his role as the British spy in the forthcoming Spectre movie, said he could “do without” people approaching him for photographs. With Spectre co-star Monica Bellucci (Andrew Medichini/AP) 
He told The Sunday Times’s Culture magazine: “If me and my mates went out and all got shit-faced, and someone started taking photographs, they’d get thumped. 
“The other thing I don’t get is, people are happy to take pictures of me without asking. But things have changed so rapidly. Here he is posing for a photo (Gero Breloer/AP) 
“Nobody really gives a fuck what I think about the modern world, but that part I can do without.” 
Questions remain about Daniel’s future as Bond – a character, by his own admission, who is deeply flawed and misogynistic – and he said he does not care who takes on the role. This time he’s taking the photo himself (Rob Griffith/AP) 
He said: “The right person for the job should do the job and I don’t give a fuck what colour their skin is. 
“It shouldn’t be an issue. We should have moved on.” And here he is obliging fans and photographers (Gero Breloer/AP) 
Spectre reunites Daniel with director Sam Mendes after 2012′s Skyfall became the highest-grossing Bond film in history. 
Naomie Harris, Ralph Fiennes, Ben Whishaw and Rory Kinnear return for Spectre, alongside newcomers to the franchise such as Christoph Waltz, Andrew Scott, Dave Bautista and Bond girls Lea Seydoux, Monica Bellucci and Stephanie Sigman. Share article 
Spectre opens in cinemas on October 26. Promoted Stories
